column7: Reece Limited Group is a leading plumbing, waterworks and HVAC-R product distributor to commercial and residential customers through over 800 branches in Australia, New Zealand and the United States.

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: Reece's limited group report included Reece Australia Pty Ltd, Plumbing World Pty, Reece Project Supply Ltd, etc.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point
column7: Reece limited group reporting period for SR and AR: July 1 2022 - June 30 2023; Reporting frequency: annually; Contact: investor.realtions@reece.com.au.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: Reece Limited Group is a leading plumbing, waterworks and HVAC-R product distributor.
Reece's governance structure comprises the Board, Audit & Risk Committee, and Remuneration Committee.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: The selection, nomination, and appointment of non-executive directors is undertaken by the board, which partners with an executive search firm as part of the process. Newly appointed Directors must stand for election at the next AGM following their appointment.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Mr Tim Poole is the chair of Reece's Board.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column13: Reece, the Company Secretary, monitors these matters and potential conflicts. The Company Secretary is responsible for all issues relating to the proper functioning of the Board and is directly accountable to the Board through the Chair on all Board matters.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: Reece has a decentralized business model empowers people to take action on sustainability. The Reece Limited Board (the Board) oversees our sustainability strategy.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Cross-disciplined teams across Reece are responsible for executing programs of work through their existing teams or specific working groups. As a decentralized business, our modern slavery working groups are made up of cross-discipline team members and led by our Chief Merchandising Officers, who are accountable to our Group and regional CEOs on this topic.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Modern slavery could refer to the efforts and policies implemented by Reece limited to combat and address modern slavery. Modern slavery encompasses various forms of exploitation, including forced labour, human trafficking, and other practices where individuals are subjected to conditions akin to slavery.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Reece Limited has implemented working groups dedicated to social impact, and these endeavours are anticipated to concentrate on developing strategies and taking actions that contribute to positive societal change. The focus extends to fostering positive transformations within the Company and making meaningful contributions to the communities in which Reece operates.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Reece often facilitates sharing insights among employees through internal communication channels such as meetings, newsletters, and collaboration platforms. It helps ensure that valuable information is disseminated across different departments and teams.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Reece publishes sustainability reports providing insights into environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices. Reece typically releases annual sustainability reports that detail their performance and initiatives in areas such as environmental impact, social responsibility, and corporate governance.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: A Sustainability working group is a team or committee within an organization focused on developing, implementing, and overseeing sustainability initiatives and practices. The Group might supervise the monitoring of Reece's sustainability performance and be involved in preparing reports.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: US sustainability working group generally refers to a collaborative team or committee within or across multiple United States organizations that focuses on sustainability initiatives and practices. Such a working group aims to drive and coordinate environmental, social, and economic sustainability efforts.

Reece has written agreements with Directors incorporating the terms of engagement and expected standards of conduct and commitment. At all times, Directors will act honestly, fairly and ethically and discharge their duties in good faith.

Communicating critical concerns within a governance structure involves conveying important issues, risks, or challenges to the appropriate levels of management and decision-makers within an organization. Communication effectiveness in governance structures is essential for addressing and mitigating potential problems.

A formal policy is a documented set of guidelines, rules, or principles established by Reece Limited to govern its actions, decisions, and processes. Legal policies serve as a framework for decision-making and provide clear expectations for employees, stakeholders, and other relevant parties.

Practices and training are vital to communicating critical concerns within an organization effectively. Implementing specific practices and providing training can enhance the ability of employees to identify, report, and address critical issues.

Codes of conduct are internal documents created by Reece Limited to outline ethical principles, standards of behaviour, and expectations for employees and stakeholders. The document is usually subject to periodic updates and revisions by Reece Limited.

A security dealing policy is a set of guidelines and rules established by a company to govern the buying and selling of its securities by individuals associated with it. This policy is designed to prevent insider trading, which involves trading a company's securities by individuals with access to non-public information about the Company.

A whistleblower policy is a set of guidelines and procedures established by Reece Limited to encourage individuals to report any suspected unethical behaviour within the organization. A whistleblower policy aims to create a safe and confidential mechanism for employees, contractors, or other stakeholders to raise concerns about misconduct, fraud, corruption, etc.

The anti-bribery and corruption policy is a set of guidelines and procedures established by Reece Limited to prevent and address bribery and corruption within its operations. The primary goal of such a policy is to ensure that the organization and its employees act ethically with relevant laws and regulations regarding corrupt practices.

The supplier Expectation guide is what Reece Limited expects of all the suppliers that work internationally and domestically. It allows potential suppliers to understand what we stand for and provides our existing suppliers an opportunity to grow with us.

A privacy policy is a legal document that outlines how Reece Limited collects, uses, processes, manages, and protects the personal information of individuals. It serves as a transparency tool, informing users or customers about the privacy practices and policies implemented by Reece Limited.

A diversity and inclusion policy is a formal statement or set of guidelines established by Reece Limited to demonstrate its commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace environment. This policy outlines the organization's stance on promoting diversity and inclusion and serves as a framework for implementing strategies and practices that foster a culture of equality, respect, and fairness.

A health and safety policy is a formal written document that outlines an organization's commitment to providing a safe and healthy working environment for its employees, contractors, visitors, and other stakeholders. The policy is a foundational document that articulates the organization's approach to managing health and safety risks.

A continuous disclosure policy is a set of guidelines and procedures to ensure timely and transparent communication of material information to the public and relevant stakeholders. This policy helps maintain market integrity, enables fair trading, and provides investors with accurate and timely information to make informed decisions.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: Reece has a customer-led strategy to build a sustainable business, empower our trade and contribute to resilient communities. Since the outset, Reece aimed to approach sustainability the way we do everythingÃ¢ÂÂ by being customer-led, implementing a proper strategy for Reece and executing over a time frame that will support long-term success.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: An internal evaluation of the performance of Executive Directors and senior executives is undertaken annually. Board members participate in an annual assessment of the performance of the Board and Board Committees.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: The highest governance body reviews the board to evaluate its performance, effectiveness, and overall governance practices. This review aims to enhance the Board's effectiveness and ensure that the Board is fulfilling its responsibilities in guiding and overseeing the organization.\t

column7: Reece is passionate about creating a values-driven and customer-focused organisation. Reece is determined to develop a business for the long term, which is reflected in how we structure incentive arrangements for our leadership team.

column13: Fix remuneration to attract and retain the right talent through competitive fixed remuneration. It consists of base salary, superannuation and other non-cash benefits.

Short-term incentive to provide an incentive for Executives to achieve annual financial and non-financial targets aligned to core drivers of long-term sustainable performance. Determined based on yearly performance against Group or business unit targets and individual performance.

Long-term incentive to align executive reward with the delivery of long-term strategic priorities and shareholder value creation. Determined based on the award of share rights based on tenure and achieving EPS and ROCE objectives.

As stakeholder expectations evolve, the Board will continue to test the effectiveness of our executive remuneration arrangements by working with external consultants, examining benchmarking information and listening to feedback from stakeholders.
